page.title: 06HISTORY OF BOWDEN KIRK
page.content: Bowden Kirk was originally founded in{1128}by the monks who were building Kelso Abbey. It is a fairly small kirk with a congregation of about 160.It has a resident minister who also preaches at Lillesleaf and Ashkirk,he lives right next to the kirk in the manse. The furniture of the chancel and nave is of carved oak,the walls being lined with chiselled ash,the floor is of tile. The kirk has two belfries and two bells.The new one is at the junction of the vestry and the chancel arch.They were placed in position in 1924.The old bell still remains were has hung for over{280}years,over the west gable end. The lairds loft is still used as the pew for the Riddel-Ker family.
